metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9446 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The vmnc decoder in the gstreamer does not initialize the render canvas, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information as demonstrated by thumbnailing a simple 1 frame vmnc movie that does not draw to the allocated render canvas.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer0.10-plugins-bad - 0.10.23-7.2ubuntu1.3
libgstreamer-plugins-bad0.10-0 - 0.10.23-7.2ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

gstreamer1.0-hybris - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-faad - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-videoparsers - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
libgstreamer-plugins-bad1.0-0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-bad0.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.23-7.2ubuntu1.3').
gst-plugins-bad1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1').
